info.game_comments:
Kathy Cassity game 2.

(Cheryl: Hi, this is Cheryl of the Clue Crew, and today we'll take you around New York City.  Come on, jump in!)

(1, 1).clue: On June 25, 1950 fighting broke out on the 38th Parallel, thus beginning this war

(2, 1).clue: The Charles Bridge that's named for a Holy Roman Emperor isn't in Boston but in this Czech capital

(3, 1).clue: You can see this large game fish on the logo of a Miami-based Major League Baseball team

(4, 1).clue: 1942 film that includes the line, "Of all the gin joints in all the towns in all the world, she walks into mine"

(5, 1).clue: Lock up your booze & shut away your daughters!  Isaac of this singing trio turned 21 on Nov. 17, 2001

(6, 1).clue: Elvis made his Top 40 debut with this song

(1, 2).clue: During the 6-Day War of 1967, Israel captured the Sinai Peninsula, West Bank, Golan Heights & this "Strip"

(2, 2).clue: This city's Gateway Arch borrowed the arch idea from the historic Eads Bridge nearby

(3, 2).clue: This state fish of Massachusetts is valued as a food & for its liver oil

(4, 2).clue: Illicitly made, this type of prohibition gin was named for a household fixture

(5, 2).clue: This 21-year-old actress seen here has over 25 movies to her credit

(6, 2).clue: Clothing phrase for showing one's feelings plainly
(6, 2).correct response: wearing one\'s heart on one\'s sleeve

(1, 3).clue: Ironically, during Iraq's war with Iran in the 1980s, this small country on its southern border provided loans & support

(2, 3).clue: It's the usual 2-word term for the type of structure seen here

(3, 3).clue: An elver is a young one of these fish

(4, 3).clue: It's carbonated water that puts this 4-letter word into the name of a gin, lemon juice & powdered sugar drink

(5, 3).clue: Almost 8 years older than brother Aaron, this Backstreet Boy was born Jan. 28, 1980

(1, 4).clue: On June 1, 1812 this U.S. president formally asked Congress for a declaration of war against Great Britain

(2, 4).clue: The Pont de Normandie at the mouth of this river features a striking fan of cables

(3, 4).clue: For its resemblance to a certain mammal, it's the common name for the puffer seen here

(4, 4).clue: Brand of gin whose logo is seen here

(5, 4).clue: Keyon Dooling is one of the big future hopes of this, um, other Los Angeles NBA team

(6, 4).clue: The proverb "Out of sight, out of mind" is contradicted by "Absence" does this

(1, 5).clue: This military campaign launched by North Vietnam on January 30, 1968 was named for the Vietnamese Lunar New Year

(2, 5).clue: The Astoria Bridge crosses this U.S. river

(3, 5).clue: The savory silver salmon with its bright red flesh is also known by this 4-letter name

(4, 5).clue: Tool name for the cocktail of gin & lime juice shaken in ice & served with a lime garnish

(5, 5).clue: Now 21, Dominique Swain is perhaps best known for her 1997 movie role as this nymphet

(6, 5).clue: The film "Apocalypse Now" is based in part on this Joseph Conrad novella

(2, 1).clue: (Hi, I'm Mackenzie Phillips)  I played this first lady at a young age in the TV drama about her "and Franklin"

(3, 1).clue: In 1921 King George V approved these as the official colours of Canada

(4, 1).clue: "I never met a man I didn't like"

(5, 1).clue: (Let's go to Cheryl in New York City via taxi for this first clue of the round.)  Lincoln Center, quick!  The curtain goes up in 10 minutes at this opera house

(6, 1).clue: Either a make-up container, or to compress

(2, 2).clue: (I'm Esai Morales)  In a 2000 TV movie, I portrayed Cuban Juan Miguel, this boy's dad

(3, 2).clue: Emily Dickinson could have been "The Belle of" this Nova Scotia city; it was named for the same lord as her city

(4, 2).clue: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past" -- The Great Gatsby

(5, 2).clue: (Cheryl continues her taxi tour around the Big Apple.)  This borough, please, for down-home cooking at the Sugar Hill Restaurant in Bedford-Stuyvesant

(6, 2).clue: Either a doctor in training, or to imprison

(1, 3).clue: "I had three" of these "in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society"

(2, 3).clue: In 1937 Paul Muni was this French novelist  who played a key role in the Dreyfus Affair

(3, 3).clue: Founded as a fur trading post in the 1790s, it's now Alberta's capital

(4, 3).clue: "...Above all else the happiest trail would be for you to say to me, 'Let's ride, my friend'. Amen"

(5, 3).clue: (Now, it's Sofia's turn to hail a cab.)  567 Hudson, the White Horse Tavern, where Bob Dylan hung out a few years after this other famous Dylan

(6, 3).clue: Either an arid place, or to run away

(1, 4).clue: "There are a thousand hacking at the branches of evil to one who is striking at" this

(2, 4).clue: "Conrack" stars Jon Voight as this novelist, back when he was a young rural teacher

(3, 4).clue: This representative of the queen is appointed by the queen on the P.M.'s recommendation

(4, 4).clue: "Subject of the decision of the Supreme Court of the United States in 1857 which denied citizenship to the Negro"

(5, 4).clue: (Cheryl returns to take her turn in the cab.)  I say, kindly convey us to the Rockefeller Plaza to trip the light fantastic at this colorful spot on the 65th floor

(6, 4).clue: Either an agricultural yield, or to manufacture something

(2, 5).clue: (Hi, I'm Jeffrey Nordling.)  I played the pivotal role of G. David Schine in a movie about this counsel to Joseph McCarthy's committee

(3, 5).clue: In 1916 this British field marshal & statesman died & the city of Berlin, Ontario was renamed for him

(4, 5).clue: "...Here lies one whose name was writ in water"

(5, 5).clue: (Cheryl wraps up our taxi tour of the city that never sleeps.)  I didn't know you had to cross a bridge to go from Broadway to this art museum on West 53rd

(6, 5).clue: Either garbage, or to decline to accept

(0, 0).clue: From the Latin for "restraint", these zones extend 900 miles north & south of the tropics
